reference.title: API Policy Adapter
reference.shortdesc: The API Policy Adapter feature allows you to configure custom API Gateway policies using the Gravitee.io policy engine.

section.p: This feature helps you to configure advanced policies on your gateway to tailor how APIs are executed. The policy provides an extra logic layer that you can use to provide additional routing, validation, or data manipulation before the request is processed by runtime.

section.title: Supported Gravitee.io policies
section.p: With the API Policy Adapter you can add Gravitee.io policies to your APIs deployed on a Gateway. The gravitee.io policies listed below are supported. Click on the links below to learn more about the policies and how to configure them.
For more information on Gravitee.io policies, refer to the Gravitee documentation.

section.title: Using Gravitee.io policies with Gateway APIs
section.p: To use a Gravitee.io policy with your API, you must:

li.p: Create a DeployedApiPolicyRule that specifies the gravitee.io rule to be used, configuration for the rule, and the HTTP methods of the requests that the rule should be applied to. After you have created a DeployedAPIPolicyRule you can modify, delete, or query it.
li.note: The DeployedApiPolicyRule is not specific to an API. After it is created, it can be assigned to one or more APIs. Graphql APIs are provided for creating DeployedApiPolicyRule, querying existing DeployedApiPolicyRules, and assigning a DeployedApiPolicyRule to a deployment. Each Graphql request must include a X-Account header, the value of the header is the user’s account identifier.

li.p: Assign the DeployedApiPolicyRule to your API deployed on an API Gateway.
